page.title: 05SANDERS PARK, BROMSGROVE-1
page.content: {Sanders Park}was given to Bromsgrove in 1910. It was given by the daughters of{Benjamin Hadley Sanders}in memory of him. He had been the clerk of the Bromsgrove Local Board for 50 years. In the middle of the park there is a pond with an island in the centre. This is ideal for a radio controlled boat,because you can go around the island. It also has some small fish in the water. There are trees,shrubs and flowers which make the park look colourful, and there are lots of benches for people to sit and rest. Next to the car park there is a doggy toilet but I've never seen a dog use it yet. At weekends there is a kiosk where you can buy ice-creams and refreshments.
